39016814.review: This game plays more into the Megaman style than the previous game. It uses the level selection of Super Mario World and it overall is a legit game rather than a rage game. This game will irritate you as you know that it is you that fucked up. The game has many references to AVGN videos and some other Cinemassacre videos and Nostalgia Critic is a reoccuring boss in this game. This game is fun to play, has all the humor of AVGN, and I really like it.

38754526.review: While the first one was unfairly difficult, to the point the progression was of little enjoyment, this sequel proves to be challenging but also rewarding. After I played the first game, I was not tempted to play the sequel, until a friend sent it as a gift. I'm glad I played this game in the end!

38691484.review: I think this game improves on the first one. It's fairer than the first one while still being challenging (at lower difficulties) for someone like me that doesn't have the patience to memorise stages. I liked having the collectibles in each stage, and the upgrades were quite helpful (finding them can be quite difficult, though).  I'd recommend for anyone that likes retro platformers, even if you don't know who the Angry Video Game Nerd is.

38678741.review: I think I actually liked it more than the first game.  It certainly wasn't as cheep with its deaths as the first.  Wouldn't minds a third game maybe.

38592343.review:
PROS:
The controls are tight. 
The upgrade system is rewarding and well balanced. 
The levels are challenging and succinct. 
The length of the game is perfect.
CONS:
Lacking in achievements. It would be nice to get a few more achievements for beating the game without powerups or running through the entire game deathless.
This game is sorely lacking one powerup - the turbo blaster. A rapid fire upgrade would have been a welcome addition.

9/10

38341668.review: Not as good as the first game, and what it essebntially boils down to is the controls.

38329736.review: Awesome modern take on the retro theme but too short and doesn't offer enough challenge. I've cleared 4/5 worlds within 90 min and secured the complete set of optional collectable cartridges on almost every level.

38246162.review: Angry Video Game Nerd II is based on the online web series of the same name. Except that it doesn't have "II" in the title. The game is filled with references to the show and is very addictive. The game can be very hard and is best played with a controller. I warn you... If you don't use a controller this can be VERY hard. Reaching the end of a level is very satisfying. Even for people who aren't fans of the show will love this game, because the challenge alone makes this game worth it. I highly recommend this game.

38145069.review:
Es la segunda parte del juego oficial del friki de nintendo mas
conocido a nivel internacional,al menos en su canal de You
Tube,Cinemassacre,no solo hace reviews de juegos sino
también de peliculas de terror antiguas,

Se nota que es una gran persona y derrocha carisma en
todos sus videos con un punto de vista algo concreto,
pero realiza reflexiones.

Esta especializado en videojuegos vintage de 8 y 16 bits,
no es muy buen jugador pero lo intenta,de todas formas
ha superado un buen puñado de juegos que almacena
en su sotano.

Su colega es Mike una persona con los mismos gustos
del Nerd pero mucho mas hardcore a la hora de jugar,
ha subido bastantes videos mostrando speedruns de
su juego favorito de NES,Castlevania.

Un invitado fue capaz de terminar Battletoads de NES
un juego muy infame con mucha leyenda a sus espaldas,
en fin que suben material de calidad dentro del mundillo
retro.

Este juego al contrario que su antecesor los mundos estan
divididos en tres niveles mas el jefe de zona,en cada nivel
encontramos a Critico el antagonista a Nerd que tratará
de eliminarnos.

Tiene muchos guiños a Megaman algunas pantallas y
tambien en los jefes aunque reune los supestamente
mas complicados en una especie de compilación.

Me gusta como esta diseñado el mapa principal que
te lleva a las diferentes areas del juego.

Se mezclan las plataformas con algunos niveles
shoot 'em up de forma muy acertada.

El juego es mas largo que la primera parte sobretodo
porque lo supera en niveles.

El objetivo del juego es obtener seis piezas que
forman parte de un hexagono para poder
desbloquear la zona final,al mas estilo Megaman.

-Areas del juego:
 Ninja gaiden.
 Area52.
 Ghost and goblins.
 Gametable.

Por último el aspecto visual es muy colorido y
logra llamar la atención de principio a fin.

Algunas partes se hacen complicadas pero
no imposibles es cuestion de ensayo y error.

Puede parecer dificil pero no injusto.

38016762.review:
Game developers were really assholes this time.

10/10.

39599432.review: AVGN 2 is an enjoyable platformer.  It controls as it should the humor is spliced in where it needs to be and the megman-esque mechanics add a lot to the game over the original.  That being said I don't think this is as good as the original, which featured a lot more exploration, and a better characterization of the Nerd's work.  I don't mind throwing the Nerd some cash because he works very hard at what he does, but this game is neither as ball numbingly hard as the first game nor is it sinfully easy.  My take away is if you like The Nerd this isn't a bad way to support him.  If you're not a fan give it a pass.

40722628.review: Fun game. Not quite as good as the original in my opinion, not as AVGN themed as the first. Very rewarding. Probably slighlty more difficult than the original, however easier in other ways. There are five worlds, plus a final world. Each world consists of a few short levels and a final boss stage. The final boss has it`s own stage, meaning we don`t have to worry about getting a game over and having to get all the way back to the boss to try again. The Nostalgia Crititic is in the game, which is awesome, but dissapointingly, he doesn`t really do anything for the story, all he does is make a bunch of jokes.

40619729.review:
Immediately, I can say with confidence that this is better than the first game. The first one in my mind was great, and this one is even better. It feels like the same game, but refined and expanded upon. The characters look great, the general style looks much better. Much more detail and better shading, and it's very pleasing to look at.

The gameplay feels pretty great. They took out the other characters, opting instead for secretive gear unlocks. I quite like this. The gear can come in handy, but it's mostly used for finding other secrets. As an example; you can get a [spoiler]power glove, that gives you a melee attack. It can hurt enemies, and also punch through some walls. The range is really low and it doesn't seem to do much damage, so you'll only really use it to punch through walls to get secrets.[/spoiler]

The powerups in this game are muuuch better. The rocks are back, but they're actually kinda useful. They bounce around, meaning they can hit enemies multiple times and kill them pretty quickly. There's also a star, which levels up your gun and lets you shoot a spread, which lasts until you get hit. You can get multiple stars if you don't get hit, and the spread gets bigger; which is pretty rewarding to people that are good at the game. 

There are many more levels, making it feel longer than the first one. There isn't a boss at the end of each level anymore, with there being specific boss stages instead. I think this works a lot better. You can choose which path you want to go down, with the level selection being a nod to Mario 3 on the NES. It's good for getting all the gear you need to unlock, if you already know where it is. Some stages are muuuch more difficult than others, and there isn't really a way to tell. Luckily, your lives go back up every time you try a new level, so experimenting isn't much of an issue.

The game runs pretty smoothly, but there were a few cases where my frames DIPPED for a second or two. I dunno if this is because of my laptop or just poor optimization, but it never happened to me during the first game. Either way, it never happened too often.

I really like how distinct the levels feel. They change the look of everything in the level for aesthetic. The background, tiles, death blocks, enemies, etc. They all feel like they correspond to the theme of each chapter, and it works wonderfully. 

Yes, there are still death blocks. They don't pop up as frequently though, and most of the really hard sections with them are in the optional secret sections. Except the final level, that one was a s s.

http://prntscr.com/inv06n And this part. Screw this part. I hate it. 

I think this game has a better sense of humour. There isn't the same death screen as the first game. He doesn't spout randomly generated text each time. You simply die, and respawn. It's smooth. Also, when a boss spouts dialogue and you die, they don't repeat it. The boss simply starts. It's small stuff like that, that really makes your experience feel a little less aggrivating. 

It's better than the original, and worth a buy in my book.

40536116.review: Not as difficult as I. Maro map style + different action games stages. After obtaining all equipment, the player will be much stronger. Good to play and enjoyable.  Btw, the BGM "Wo Ai Beijing TianAnMen"....is intersting.

40513617.review:
I like the Nerd, but this is not a very fun game. It's kinda fun, but there are a lot of parts where it's a not buy and where it might be for you.



Pros:
1. Controls are so much better from the original, now we have more fluid control with the Nerd character.
2. Can now wall jump which can save your ass if your about to fall to doom-gloom.
3. Upgrades, you don't get them after every boss, but it's still a nice addition to the game.
4. You can use pretty much any controller you want, even a SNES controller like me, not just a Playstation or Xbox 360 controller.
5. Graphics are better than the original in my opinion, that's subjective for some.
6. There are pretty cool mechanics such as the colour switching on the 2nd level of the Ghost n' goblin level, from Black & White to colour for platforms to appear, that's pretty cool.

Cons:
1. Lag. Some parts in the game where lag makes it unplayable like the Ninja Gaiden levels for example.
2. Unfair deaths, example, the ghost n' goblin levels with the thwomps, sometimes they crush you out of no where after a stress inducing part of the level.
3. The writing got worse, the original game had pretty good writing, but now there are stuff in the game that the Nerd never mentioned in his AVGN reviews such as Sexforce, maybe I'm missing something, but the Nerd never said anything about that in his videos.
4. Some enemies from repeated from the original game, wish they made more new enemies.
5. I get sick of toilet humour after some time, but pretty the whole game is toilet humour. It just annoys me, but now I'm just being nit-picky.
6. The music sounds like a drunk DJ it playing around with the record, music is subjective, you might think it's the best music in the world, but I like music with a little more substance. sorry if I sound "hipsterish".



If you still want this game, I would wait for it to go on sale which I did, and yes, I do realize they're referencing the nerd's experence with bad nes games, but horrible game mechanics don't make a game fun or even funny. I feel like they're nudging their elbow at me thinking I would get it, I do get it, but it's not funny when a game is purposly bad just to be a joke, I would expect it from a 16 year old making a bad game for the "lol's". But, I do not recommend it to "special-snowflakes" I guess some people would call me.

39838192.review: A couple negatives out of the way: The first time I played, it crashed after the tutorial and I couldn't get back in. Thankfully it seemed like uninstalling the game and installing it again helped, and so far it hasn't happened again. Also, there's a bit of graphical glitchyness going on around the top of the screen, though it seems like other people's results will vary with both of these issues. Other than that, this is a really nice improvement over the first game. The controls feel nicer, and you can wall jump Ninja Gaiden style, which is cool. I love the Mario 3 styled map and my favorite area is the part with the giant tanuki. If you've ever seen a tanuki statue, you'll understand why. Haha
